    ","data":{"date":"2020-12-26T00:00:00.000Z","title":"Top 5 Css Methodologies In 2021","author":"Spruce","summary":"See the top 5 css methodologies in 2021 \n","preview":"img/preview.jpg","sharing":{"twitter":"Top 5 Css Methodologies In 2021","facebook":"Top 5 Css Methodologies In 2021"}},"isEmpty":false,"excerpt":""},"_layoutKey":"layouts/posts.liquid","dataCache":{"layout":"layouts/posts.liquid","tags":["norm"],"date":"2020-12-26T00:00:00.000Z","title":"Top 5 Css Methodologies In 2021","author":"Spruce","summary":"See the top 5 css methodologies in 2021 \n","preview":"img/preview.jpg","page":{"date":"2020-12-26T00:00:00.000Z","inputPath":"./src/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/index.md","fileSlug":"top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021","filePathStem":"/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/index","url":"/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/","outputPath":"public/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/index.html"}},"computedData":{"computed":{"page":{}},"templateStringKeyLookup":{"page.url":true,"page.outputPath":true},"computedKeys":{},"declaredDependencies":{"page.url":[],"page.outputPath":[]},"queue":{"graph":{"nodes":{},"outgoingEdges":{},"incomingEdges":{}}}}},"inputPath":"./src/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/index.md","fileSlug":"top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021","filePathStem":"/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/index","data":{"layout":"layouts/posts.liquid","date":"2020-12-26T00:00:00.000Z","title":"Top 5 Css Methodologies In 2021","author":"Spruce","summary":"See the top 5 css methodologies in 2021 \n","preview":"img/preview.jpg"},"date":"2020-12-26T00:00:00.000Z","outputPath":"public/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/index.html","url":"/blog/top-5-css-methodologies-in-2021/","templateContent":"

    Css is very difficult to manage when you are dealing with a large system, this is because Everything in css is Global

    \n
    \n  \n\n<button class=\"button button-action\">\n    Load More\n  </button>\n\n  <!-- css -->\n\n  .button {\n    background: blue;\n  }\n  .button-action {\n    background: pink;\n  }\n\n  // then maybe after 3 months on line 1299...\n  // another developer wants a call to action button\n  // and he declares another class with button-action with background color red\n\n  .button-action {\n    background: red;\n  }\n\n  \n
    \n

    \n you might be wondering what will be the background color of the button, well like i said earlier everything in css is Global, what will happen is that all three background properties will move to the top of the Scope like this...\n

    \n
      \n
    1. \nbackground: blue;\n
      2. \n
    2. \nbackground: pink;\n
      3. \n
    3. \nbackground: red;\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \nThen the browser will go through the code and apply all of them. Yeah all of them, and then decide to use the last one\n

    \n
    \n  \n
    // the browser will read the code like this from top to bottom
    \n
    <!-- css -->
    \n
    background: blue; // oh here is a background with color of blue, use this.
    \n
    background: pink; // wait, don't use that, here is another background with color pink, definately use this.
    \n
    background: red; // what's wrong with this developer, here is another background with color red, jeez, is there another one?. nope, then use this.
    \n
    &lt;!-- Html --&gt;\n\n&lt;button class="button button-action"&gt;\nLoad More\n
    \n
    >/button>
    \n      \n
    \n\n

    \nThe problem of managing css is what every developer must face one way or the other, not to mention (one of the hardest thing in css) naming classes, along the line you are going to run out of class names, that's where css methodologies comes in play(sticking to a particular naming convention)... \n

    \n

    \nWhat are css methodologies?\n

    \n

    \ncss methodologies are systems that are formaly documented down that help us to auhor/write css as isolated modules, rather than just some long indivisible code.\n

    \n

    \nTop 5 Css Methodologies in 2021\n

    \n

    \n1. Atomic Css\n

    \n

    \nAtomic Css is a collection of single purpose styling units that fits well with components in templated framewoks...\n

    \n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using Atomic Css\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nMoves specifity out of the way\n
      2. \n
    2. \nImproves performance\n
      3. \n
    3. \nAllows to share content and assets easily\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nAtomic css frequently asked questions\n
      2. \n
    2. \nAtomic Css Quick Start\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n2. BEM\n

    \n

    \nBEM stands for - BLOCKS, ELEMENTS and MODIFIERS\n

    \n

    \nBlock:
    \nThis are standalone entity that is meaningful on its own

    \nElement:
    \nA part of a block that has no standalone meaning (it must be used within a block)

    \nModifier:
    \nA flag on a block or element, basically we use this to change the appearance or state of an element.\n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using BEM\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nModularity\n
      2. \n
    2. \nReusability\n
      3. \n
    3. \nStructure\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nIntro to BEM\n
      2. \n
    2. \nBEM\n
      3. \n
    3. \nBEM naming convention\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n3. ITCSS\n

    \n

    \nITCSS - stands for INVERTED TRIANGLE CSS\n

    \n

    \nThis is a methodolgy for structuring your css files in the best and stress free way as possible.\n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using ITCSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nLess thinking on naming things\n
      2. \n
    2. \nReusability\n
      3. \n
    3. \nFlexibility\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nITCSS: Scalable and Maintainable Css Architecture\n
      2. \n
    2. \nIntro to ITCSS for web developers\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n4. SMACSS\n

    \n

    \nSMACSS stands for - SCALABLE and MODULAR ARCHITECTURE for CSS\n

    \n

    \n

    \nBenefits of using SMACSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nScalable\n
      2. \n
    2. \nEase of Reading\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nSmacss guide\n
      2. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n5. OOCSS\n

    \n

    \nOOCSS stands for - OBJECT ORIENTED CSS\n

    \n
    \nTwo main principles of OOCSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nSeparating Structure From Skin\n
      2. \n
    2. \nSeparating Container And Content\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using OOCSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nMaintainable stylesheets\n
      2. \n
    2. \nFaster websites\n
      3. \n
    3. \nEasier to modify common styles\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nObject oriented Css\n
      2. \n
    2. \nIntro to object oriented css on smashingmagazine\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n

    \nThis list is based on the survey from The state of css 2020, and it is intended to show you the css methodologies that would probably be used in 2021 \n

    \n

    \nAnother css methodology that is currently on a fast rise is the Cube Css\n

    \n
    \n
    \n Note: There is no best css methodology, the one you decide to use depends on you and the type of your project...\n
    \n
    \n

    \nThanks for reading\n

    ","_templateContent":"

    Css is very difficult to manage when you are dealing with a large system, this is because Everything in css is Global

    \n
    \n  \n\n<button class=\"button button-action\">\n    Load More\n  </button>\n\n  <!-- css -->\n\n  .button {\n    background: blue;\n  }\n  .button-action {\n    background: pink;\n  }\n\n  // then maybe after 3 months on line 1299...\n  // another developer wants a call to action button\n  // and he declares another class with button-action with background color red\n\n  .button-action {\n    background: red;\n  }\n\n  \n
    \n

    \n you might be wondering what will be the background color of the button, well like i said earlier everything in css is Global, what will happen is that all three background properties will move to the top of the Scope like this...\n

    \n
      \n
    1. \nbackground: blue;\n
      2. \n
    2. \nbackground: pink;\n
      3. \n
    3. \nbackground: red;\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \nThen the browser will go through the code and apply all of them. Yeah all of them, and then decide to use the last one\n

    \n
    \n  \n
    // the browser will read the code like this from top to bottom
    \n
    <!-- css -->
    \n
    background: blue; // oh here is a background with color of blue, use this.
    \n
    background: pink; // wait, don't use that, here is another background with color pink, definately use this.
    \n
    background: red; // what's wrong with this developer, here is another background with color red, jeez, is there another one?. nope, then use this.
    \n
    &lt;!-- Html --&gt;\n\n&lt;button class="button button-action"&gt;\nLoad More\n
    \n
    >/button>
    \n      \n
    \n\n

    \nThe problem of managing css is what every developer must face one way or the other, not to mention (one of the hardest thing in css) naming classes, along the line you are going to run out of class names, that's where css methodologies comes in play(sticking to a particular naming convention)... \n

    \n

    \nWhat are css methodologies?\n

    \n

    \ncss methodologies are systems that are formaly documented down that help us to auhor/write css as isolated modules, rather than just some long indivisible code.\n

    \n

    \nTop 5 Css Methodologies in 2021\n

    \n

    \n1. Atomic Css\n

    \n

    \nAtomic Css is a collection of single purpose styling units that fits well with components in templated framewoks...\n

    \n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using Atomic Css\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nMoves specifity out of the way\n
      2. \n
    2. \nImproves performance\n
      3. \n
    3. \nAllows to share content and assets easily\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nAtomic css frequently asked questions\n
      2. \n
    2. \nAtomic Css Quick Start\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n2. BEM\n

    \n

    \nBEM stands for - BLOCKS, ELEMENTS and MODIFIERS\n

    \n

    \nBlock:
    \nThis are standalone entity that is meaningful on its own

    \nElement:
    \nA part of a block that has no standalone meaning (it must be used within a block)

    \nModifier:
    \nA flag on a block or element, basically we use this to change the appearance or state of an element.\n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using BEM\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nModularity\n
      2. \n
    2. \nReusability\n
      3. \n
    3. \nStructure\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nIntro to BEM\n
      2. \n
    2. \nBEM\n
      3. \n
    3. \nBEM naming convention\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n3. ITCSS\n

    \n

    \nITCSS - stands for INVERTED TRIANGLE CSS\n

    \n

    \nThis is a methodolgy for structuring your css files in the best and stress free way as possible.\n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using ITCSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nLess thinking on naming things\n
      2. \n
    2. \nReusability\n
      3. \n
    3. \nFlexibility\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nITCSS: Scalable and Maintainable Css Architecture\n
      2. \n
    2. \nIntro to ITCSS for web developers\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n4. SMACSS\n

    \n

    \nSMACSS stands for - SCALABLE and MODULAR ARCHITECTURE for CSS\n

    \n

    \n

    \nBenefits of using SMACSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nScalable\n
      2. \n
    2. \nEase of Reading\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nSmacss guide\n
      2. \n
    \n

    \n

    \n5. OOCSS\n

    \n

    \nOOCSS stands for - OBJECT ORIENTED CSS\n

    \n
    \nTwo main principles of OOCSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nSeparating Structure From Skin\n
      2. \n
    2. \nSeparating Container And Content\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nBenefits of using OOCSS\n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nMaintainable stylesheets\n
      2. \n
    2. \nFaster websites\n
      3. \n
    3. \nEasier to modify common styles\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n
    \nFurther reading \n
    \n
      \n
    1. \nObject oriented Css\n
      2. \n
    2. \nIntro to object oriented css on smashingmagazine\n
      3. \n
    \n

    \n

    \nThis list is based on the survey from The state of css 2020, and it is intended to show you the css methodologies that would probably be used in 2021 \n

    \n

    \nAnother css methodology that is currently on a fast rise is the Cube Css\n

    \n
    \n
    \n Note: There is no best css methodology, the one you decide to use depends on you and the type of your project...\n
    \n
    \n

    \nThanks for reading\n

    "},{"template":{"inputPath":"./src/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","inputDir":"src","parsed":{"root":"","dir":"./src/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects","base":"index.md","ext":".md","name":"index","extname":".md","basename":"index.md","dirname":"./src/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects","stem":"index","path":"./src/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","absolute":"C:\\Users\\welcome\\Documents\\spruce-blog\\src\\blog\\5-cool-css-only-line-effects\\index.md","isAbsolute":false},"extraOutputSubdirectory":"","outputDir":"public","linters":[],"transforms":[],"plugins":{},"paginationData":{},"isVerbose":true,"isDryRun":false,"writeCount":0,"skippedCount":0,"wrapWithLayouts":true,"fileSlug":{"inputPath":"blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","cleanInputPath":"blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","dirs":["blog","5-cool-css-only-line-effects"],"parsed":{"root":"","dir":"blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects","base":"index.md","ext":".md","name":"index","extname":".md","basename":"index.md","dirname":"blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects","stem":"index","path":"blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","absolute":"C:\\Users\\welcome\\Documents\\spruce-blog\\blog\\5-cool-css-only-line-effects\\index.md","isAbsolute":false},"filenameNoExt":"index"},"fileSlugStr":"5-cool-css-only-line-effects","filePathStem":"/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index","_templateRender":{"engineNameOrPath":"./src/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","inputDir":"src","includesDir":"src/_includes","parseMarkdownWith":"liquid","parseHtmlWith":"liquid","_engineName":"md","useMarkdown":true},"inputContent":"---\r\ndate: 2021-01-01\r\ntitle: How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect\r\nauthor: Spruce\r\nauthorLink: spruce.emma\r\nsummary: 'Who said css lines has to be boring? Or just a straight line'\r\npreview: img/preview.png\r\nsharing:\r\n twitter: How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect\r\n facebook: How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect\r\n--- \r\n\r\n

    \r\nWhen we talk about css lines we shouldn't always think about ordinary \"one way straight lines\"\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nLines can be used to style up our web pages in a lot of ways. That is, just 5 effects are just a few things you could do with Lines\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nWhat would make this effects fun is that you only get to use CSS, no images are used here\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nNote: Some of this effect can be achieved using images too\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nCss only Line effects\r\n

    \r\n
      \r\n
    1. \r\n \r\nHighlight Text\r\n\r\n
      2. \r\n
    2. \r\n \r\nLines on both side of an Element\r\n\r\n
      3. \r\n
    3. \r\n \r\nCss Wavy line\r\n\r\n
      4. \r\n
    4. \r\n \r\nLine Hover Effect\r\n\r\n
      5. \r\n
    5. \r\n \r\nAdd line in the middle of a word\r\n\r\n
      6. \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nLet's jump right into actually creating this stuff\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nHighlight Text\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nNow you might be surprised how easy it is to highlight a whole paragraph of text with one line of css...\r\n

    \r\n
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n <p class=\"highlight-text\">\r\n  Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi?\r\n <p>\r\n\r\n// Css \r\n// Only trick here is to make sure the element is inline\r\n\r\n .highlight-text {\r\n display: inline; // enforce inline\r\nbackground: linear-gradient(180deg, rgba(225,225,225,0) 50%, #00bb00 50%);\r\n}\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nAnd that's it, preview should look like this\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\n Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi? \r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nLines on both side of an Element\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nYou might be wondering, how do I place lines on both side of an Element in the most less messy way. It's actually kind of a breeze with css LINEAR-GRADIENT\r\n

    \r\n\r\n
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n  <div class=\"lines\">\r\n    <input type=\"submit\" class=\"btn btn--small btn--primary\" value=\"button\">\r\n    </div>\r\n\r\n// Css \r\n\r\n .lines {\r\n    text-align: center;\r\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\r\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\r\n    background-repeat: no-repeat;\r\n    background-position: center center;\r\n    margin: 2em 0;\r\n}\r\n.llines .btn\r\n {\r\n display:inline-block;\r\n box-shadow:0 0 0 1em #fff;\r\n} \r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    that's it, the preview should look like this\r\n

    \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nCss Wavy lines\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nWith just a single div you can create a Wavy effect with pure css\r\n

    \r\n\r\n 
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n <div class=\"wavy-line\"><div>\r\n\r\n// Css\r\n\r\n.wavy-line {\r\n    position: relative;\r\n    width: 100vw;\r\n    height: 50px;\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\r\n    content: \"\";\r\n    display: block;\r\n    position: absolute;\r\n    width: 100vw; /*same width as container*/\r\n    height: 26px;\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::after {\r\n    background: linear-gradient(45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::before {\r\n    background: linear-gradient(-45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\r\n    background-size: 50px 50px;\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nThere you go, and the preview should look like the one below\r\n

    \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n\r\n\r\n

    \r\nAnimate line on hover\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nAnother cool thing you can do with css lines is animating them....\r\n

    \r\n\r\n 
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n     <a href=\"#0\" class=\"line-animate\">\r\n        hover me\r\n    </a>\r\n\r\n// Css\r\n\r\n.line-animate {\r\n    display: inline-block;\r\n    text-decoration: none;\r\n    font-size: 26px;\r\n    color: green;\r\n    position: relative;\r\n}\r\n.line-animate:hover.line-animate::after {\r\n    content: \"\";\r\n    display: block;\r\n    width: 100%;\r\n    height: 4px;\r\n    position: absolute;\r\n    top: 100%;\r\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\r\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\r\n    animation: animate .5s linear;\r\n\r\n}\r\n\r\n@keyframes animate {\r\n    0% {\r\n        width: 0;\r\n    }\r\n    50% {\r\n        width: 100%;\r\n    }\r\n    0% {\r\n        width: 0;\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n
    \r\n \r\n hover me\r\n \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nAnd there you have it, a cool hover line effect created with css\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nAdd line in the middle of a word\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nHave you ever wanted create a header text like the one below?\r\n

    \r\n \r\n\r\n

    \r\nWhat if I told you it is quite easy to do with CSS \r\n

    \r\n\r\n 
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n   <div class=\"line-before\">\r\n     <span class=\"line-before__inner\">\r\n     Latest posts\r\n    </span>\r\n    </div>\r\n\r\n// Css \r\n.line-before__inner {\r\n position:relative;\r\n display:block;\r\n width:100%;\r\n color:#333;\r\n background-position:center;\r\n z-index:2;\r\n padding-left:calc(100px + 1em);\r\n}\r\n\r\n.line-before__inner::before {\r\n content:'';\r\n position:absolute;\r\n display:block;\r\n width:100px;\r\n height:1px;\r\n background-color:currentColor;\r\n left:0;\r\n top:50%\r\n} \r\n\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n \r\n Latest posts\r\n \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nThe CSS above is self explanatory, so that's how to add a line in the middle of a text item\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nThanks for reading\r\n

    \r\n","frontMatter":{"content":" \r\n\r\n

    \r\nWhen we talk about css lines we shouldn't always think about ordinary \"one way straight lines\"\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nLines can be used to style up our web pages in a lot of ways. That is, just 5 effects are just a few things you could do with Lines\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nWhat would make this effects fun is that you only get to use CSS, no images are used here\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nNote: Some of this effect can be achieved using images too\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nCss only Line effects\r\n

    \r\n
      \r\n
    1. \r\n \r\nHighlight Text\r\n\r\n
      2. \r\n
    2. \r\n \r\nLines on both side of an Element\r\n\r\n
      3. \r\n
    3. \r\n \r\nCss Wavy line\r\n\r\n
      4. \r\n
    4. \r\n \r\nLine Hover Effect\r\n\r\n
      5. \r\n
    5. \r\n \r\nAdd line in the middle of a word\r\n\r\n
      6. \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nLet's jump right into actually creating this stuff\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nHighlight Text\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nNow you might be surprised how easy it is to highlight a whole paragraph of text with one line of css...\r\n

    \r\n
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n <p class=\"highlight-text\">\r\n  Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi?\r\n <p>\r\n\r\n// Css \r\n// Only trick here is to make sure the element is inline\r\n\r\n .highlight-text {\r\n display: inline; // enforce inline\r\nbackground: linear-gradient(180deg, rgba(225,225,225,0) 50%, #00bb00 50%);\r\n}\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nAnd that's it, preview should look like this\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\n Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi? \r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nLines on both side of an Element\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nYou might be wondering, how do I place lines on both side of an Element in the most less messy way. It's actually kind of a breeze with css LINEAR-GRADIENT\r\n

    \r\n\r\n
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n  <div class=\"lines\">\r\n    <input type=\"submit\" class=\"btn btn--small btn--primary\" value=\"button\">\r\n    </div>\r\n\r\n// Css \r\n\r\n .lines {\r\n    text-align: center;\r\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\r\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\r\n    background-repeat: no-repeat;\r\n    background-position: center center;\r\n    margin: 2em 0;\r\n}\r\n.llines .btn\r\n {\r\n display:inline-block;\r\n box-shadow:0 0 0 1em #fff;\r\n} \r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    that's it, the preview should look like this\r\n

    \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nCss Wavy lines\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nWith just a single div you can create a Wavy effect with pure css\r\n

    \r\n\r\n 
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n <div class=\"wavy-line\"><div>\r\n\r\n// Css\r\n\r\n.wavy-line {\r\n    position: relative;\r\n    width: 100vw;\r\n    height: 50px;\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\r\n    content: \"\";\r\n    display: block;\r\n    position: absolute;\r\n    width: 100vw; /*same width as container*/\r\n    height: 26px;\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::after {\r\n    background: linear-gradient(45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::before {\r\n    background: linear-gradient(-45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\r\n}\r\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\r\n    background-size: 50px 50px;\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nThere you go, and the preview should look like the one below\r\n

    \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n\r\n\r\n

    \r\nAnimate line on hover\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nAnother cool thing you can do with css lines is animating them....\r\n

    \r\n\r\n 
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n     <a href=\"#0\" class=\"line-animate\">\r\n        hover me\r\n    </a>\r\n\r\n// Css\r\n\r\n.line-animate {\r\n    display: inline-block;\r\n    text-decoration: none;\r\n    font-size: 26px;\r\n    color: green;\r\n    position: relative;\r\n}\r\n.line-animate:hover.line-animate::after {\r\n    content: \"\";\r\n    display: block;\r\n    width: 100%;\r\n    height: 4px;\r\n    position: absolute;\r\n    top: 100%;\r\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\r\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\r\n    animation: animate .5s linear;\r\n\r\n}\r\n\r\n@keyframes animate {\r\n    0% {\r\n        width: 0;\r\n    }\r\n    50% {\r\n        width: 100%;\r\n    }\r\n    0% {\r\n        width: 0;\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n
    \r\n \r\n hover me\r\n \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nAnd there you have it, a cool hover line effect created with css\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nAdd line in the middle of a word\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nHave you ever wanted create a header text like the one below?\r\n

    \r\n \r\n\r\n

    \r\nWhat if I told you it is quite easy to do with CSS \r\n

    \r\n\r\n 
    \r\n\r\n // HTML code\r\n   <div class=\"line-before\">\r\n     <span class=\"line-before__inner\">\r\n     Latest posts\r\n    </span>\r\n    </div>\r\n\r\n// Css \r\n.line-before__inner {\r\n position:relative;\r\n display:block;\r\n width:100%;\r\n color:#333;\r\n background-position:center;\r\n z-index:2;\r\n padding-left:calc(100px + 1em);\r\n}\r\n\r\n.line-before__inner::before {\r\n content:'';\r\n position:absolute;\r\n display:block;\r\n width:100px;\r\n height:1px;\r\n background-color:currentColor;\r\n left:0;\r\n top:50%\r\n} \r\n\r\n\r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n\r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n \r\n Latest posts\r\n \r\n
    \r\n
    \r\n

    \r\n

    \r\nThe CSS above is self explanatory, so that's how to add a line in the middle of a text item\r\n

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\nThanks for reading\r\n

    \r\n","data":{"date":"2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z","title":"How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect","author":"Spruce","authorLink":"spruce.emma","summary":"Who said css lines has to be boring? Or just a straight line","preview":"img/preview.png","sharing":{"twitter":"How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect","facebook":"How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect"}},"isEmpty":false,"excerpt":""},"_layoutKey":"layouts/posts.liquid","dataCache":{"layout":"layouts/posts.liquid","tags":["norm"],"date":"2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z","title":"How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect","author":"Spruce","authorLink":"spruce.emma","summary":"Who said css lines has to be boring? Or just a straight line","preview":"img/preview.png","page":{"date":"2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z","inputPath":"./src/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","fileSlug":"5-cool-css-only-line-effects","filePathStem":"/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index","url":"/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/","outputPath":"public/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.html"}},"computedData":{"computed":{"page":{}},"templateStringKeyLookup":{"page.url":true,"page.outputPath":true},"computedKeys":{},"declaredDependencies":{"page.url":[],"page.outputPath":[]},"queue":{"graph":{"nodes":{},"outgoingEdges":{},"incomingEdges":{}}}}},"inputPath":"./src/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.md","fileSlug":"5-cool-css-only-line-effects","filePathStem":"/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index","data":{"layout":"layouts/posts.liquid","date":"2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z","title":"How to create 5 Cool Css only line effect","author":"Spruce","authorLink":"spruce.emma","summary":"Who said css lines has to be boring? Or just a straight line","preview":"img/preview.png"},"date":"2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z","outputPath":"public/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/index.html","url":"/blog/5-cool-css-only-line-effects/","templateContent":"

    \nWhen we talk about css lines we shouldn't always think about ordinary \"one way straight lines\"\n

    \n

    \nLines can be used to style up our web pages in a lot of ways. That is, just 5 effects are just a few things you could do with Lines\n

    \n

    \nWhat would make this effects fun is that you only get to use CSS, no images are used here\n

    \n

    \nNote: Some of this effect can be achieved using images too\n

    \n

    \nCss only Line effects\n

    \n
      \n
    1. \n \nHighlight Text\n\n
      2. \n
    2. \n \nLines on both side of an Element\n\n
      3. \n
    3. \n \nCss Wavy line\n\n
      4. \n
    4. \n \nLine Hover Effect\n\n
      5. \n
    5. \n \nAdd line in the middle of a word\n\n
      6. \n
    \n

    \n

    \nLet's jump right into actually creating this stuff\n

    \n

    \nHighlight Text\n

    \n

    \nNow you might be surprised how easy it is to highlight a whole paragraph of text with one line of css...\n

    \n
    \n\n // HTML code\n <p class=\"highlight-text\">\n  Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi?\n <p>\n
    // Css\n// Only trick here is to make sure the element is inline
    \n
    .highlight-text {\ndisplay: inline; // enforce inline\nbackground: linear-gradient(180deg, rgba(225,225,225,0) 50%, #00bb00 50%);\n}\n\n

    \n

    \n

    \nAnd that's it, preview should look like this\n

    \n

    \n Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi? \n

    \n

    \nLines on both side of an Element\n

    \n

    \nYou might be wondering, how do I place lines on both side of an Element in the most less messy way. It's actually kind of a breeze with css LINEAR-GRADIENT\n

    \n
    \n\n // HTML code\n  <div class=\"lines\">\n    <input type=\"submit\" class=\"btn btn--small btn--primary\" value=\"button\">\n    </div>\n\n// Css \n\n .lines {\n    text-align: center;\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\n    background-repeat: no-repeat;\n    background-position: center center;\n    margin: 2em 0;\n}\n.llines .btn\n {\n display:inline-block;\n box-shadow:0 0 0 1em #fff;\n} \n\n
    \n

    \n

    that's it, the preview should look like this\n

    \n
    \n
    \n \n
    \n
    \n

    \n

    \nCss Wavy lines\n

    \n

    \nWith just a single div you can create a Wavy effect with pure css\n

    \n 
    \n\n // HTML code\n <div class=\"wavy-line\"><div>\n\n// Css\n\n.wavy-line {\n    position: relative;\n    width: 100vw;\n    height: 50px;\n}\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\n    content: \"\";\n    display: block;\n    position: absolute;\n    width: 100vw; /*same width as container*/\n    height: 26px;\n}\n.wavy-line::after {\n    background: linear-gradient(45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\n}\n.wavy-line::before {\n    background: linear-gradient(-45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\n}\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\n    background-size: 50px 50px;\n}\n\n\n
    \n

    \n

    \nThere you go, and the preview should look like the one below\n

    \n
    \n
    \n
    \n

    \nAnimate line on hover\n

    \n

    \nAnother cool thing you can do with css lines is animating them....\n

    \n 
    \n\n // HTML code\n     <a href=\"#0\" class=\"line-animate\">\n        hover me\n    </a>\n\n// Css\n\n.line-animate {\n    display: inline-block;\n    text-decoration: none;\n    font-size: 26px;\n    color: green;\n    position: relative;\n}\n.line-animate:hover.line-animate::after {\n    content: \"\";\n    display: block;\n    width: 100%;\n    height: 4px;\n    position: absolute;\n    top: 100%;\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\n    animation: animate .5s linear;\n\n}\n\n@keyframes animate {\n    0% {\n        width: 0;\n    }\n    50% {\n        width: 100%;\n    }\n    0% {\n        width: 0;\n    }\n}\n\n\n
    \n

    \n
    \n \n hover me\n \n
    \n

    \n

    \nAnd there you have it, a cool hover line effect created with css\n

    \n

    \nAdd line in the middle of a word\n

    \n

    \nHave you ever wanted create a header text like the one below?\n

    \n \n

    \nWhat if I told you it is quite easy to do with CSS \n

    \n 
    \n\n // HTML code\n   <div class=\"line-before\">\n     <span class=\"line-before__inner\">\n     Latest posts\n    </span>\n    </div>\n\n// Css \n.line-before__inner {\n position:relative;\n display:block;\n width:100%;\n color:#333;\n background-position:center;\n z-index:2;\n padding-left:calc(100px + 1em);\n}\n\n.line-before__inner::before {\n content:'';\n position:absolute;\n display:block;\n width:100px;\n height:1px;\n background-color:currentColor;\n left:0;\n top:50%\n} \n\n\n
    \n

    \n
    \n
    \n \n Latest posts\n \n
    \n
    \n

    \n

    \nThe CSS above is self explanatory, so that's how to add a line in the middle of a text item\n

    \n

    \nThanks for reading\n

    \n","_templateContent":"

    \nWhen we talk about css lines we shouldn't always think about ordinary \"one way straight lines\"\n

    \n

    \nLines can be used to style up our web pages in a lot of ways. That is, just 5 effects are just a few things you could do with Lines\n

    \n

    \nWhat would make this effects fun is that you only get to use CSS, no images are used here\n

    \n

    \nNote: Some of this effect can be achieved using images too\n

    \n

    \nCss only Line effects\n

    \n
      \n
    1. \n \nHighlight Text\n\n
      2. \n
    2. \n \nLines on both side of an Element\n\n
      3. \n
    3. \n \nCss Wavy line\n\n
      4. \n
    4. \n \nLine Hover Effect\n\n
      5. \n
    5. \n \nAdd line in the middle of a word\n\n
      6. \n
    \n

    \n

    \nLet's jump right into actually creating this stuff\n

    \n

    \nHighlight Text\n

    \n

    \nNow you might be surprised how easy it is to highlight a whole paragraph of text with one line of css...\n

    \n
    \n\n // HTML code\n <p class=\"highlight-text\">\n  Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi?\n <p>\n
    // Css\n// Only trick here is to make sure the element is inline
    \n
    .highlight-text {\ndisplay: inline; // enforce inline\nbackground: linear-gradient(180deg, rgba(225,225,225,0) 50%, #00bb00 50%);\n}\n\n

    \n

    \n

    \nAnd that's it, preview should look like this\n

    \n

    \n Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. At nam dignissimos nemo nihil iure illo nisi nobis voluptatum sit architecto reprehenderit, quibusdam molestiae, sunt, distinctio ea vero? Error, minus excepturi? \n

    \n

    \nLines on both side of an Element\n

    \n

    \nYou might be wondering, how do I place lines on both side of an Element in the most less messy way. It's actually kind of a breeze with css LINEAR-GRADIENT\n

    \n
    \n\n // HTML code\n  <div class=\"lines\">\n    <input type=\"submit\" class=\"btn btn--small btn--primary\" value=\"button\">\n    </div>\n\n// Css \n\n .lines {\n    text-align: center;\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\n    background-repeat: no-repeat;\n    background-position: center center;\n    margin: 2em 0;\n}\n.llines .btn\n {\n display:inline-block;\n box-shadow:0 0 0 1em #fff;\n} \n\n
    \n

    \n

    that's it, the preview should look like this\n

    \n
    \n
    \n \n
    \n
    \n

    \n

    \nCss Wavy lines\n

    \n

    \nWith just a single div you can create a Wavy effect with pure css\n

    \n 
    \n\n // HTML code\n <div class=\"wavy-line\"><div>\n\n// Css\n\n.wavy-line {\n    position: relative;\n    width: 100vw;\n    height: 50px;\n}\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\n    content: \"\";\n    display: block;\n    position: absolute;\n    width: 100vw; /*same width as container*/\n    height: 26px;\n}\n.wavy-line::after {\n    background: linear-gradient(45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\n}\n.wavy-line::before {\n    background: linear-gradient(-45deg, transparent, transparent 49%, green 49%, transparent 51%);\n}\n.wavy-line::before, .line::after {\n    background-size: 50px 50px;\n}\n\n\n
    \n

    \n

    \nThere you go, and the preview should look like the one below\n

    \n
    \n
    \n
    \n

    \nAnimate line on hover\n

    \n

    \nAnother cool thing you can do with css lines is animating them....\n

    \n 
    \n\n // HTML code\n     <a href=\"#0\" class=\"line-animate\">\n        hover me\n    </a>\n\n// Css\n\n.line-animate {\n    display: inline-block;\n    text-decoration: none;\n    font-size: 26px;\n    color: green;\n    position: relative;\n}\n.line-animate:hover.line-animate::after {\n    content: \"\";\n    display: block;\n    width: 100%;\n    height: 4px;\n    position: absolute;\n    top: 100%;\n    background-image: linear-gradient(#ddd,#ddd);\n    background-size: 100% .1em;\n    animation: animate .5s linear;\n\n}\n\n@keyframes animate {\n    0% {\n        width: 0;\n    }\n    50% {\n        width: 100%;\n    }\n    0% {\n        width: 0;\n    }\n}\n\n\n
    \n

    \n
    \n \n hover me\n \n
    \n

    \n

    \nAnd there you have it, a cool hover line effect created with css\n

    \n

    \nAdd line in the middle of a word\n

    \n

    \n"}],"norm":[null,null,null,null,null,null,null]}},"date":"2020-12-20T00:00:00.000Z","outputPath":"public/blog/create-a-blog-on-your-mobile-phone/index.html","url":"/blog/create-a-blog-on-your-mobile-phone/","templateContent":"

    \nWelcome to the series \"How to create a blog on your mobile phone with Jekyll on Github\"\n

    \n

    \nYep i said it... You can create a free blog from your mobile phone, so get ready to start your journey as a blogger... \n

    \n

    \na lot of people do ask:\n

      \n
    1. \nHow can i create a website with my phone?\n
      2. \n
    2. \nCan we blog from mobile?\n
      3. \n
    3. \nwhat is the best phone for blogging?\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n

    \nYes, Yes and Yes you can create a website with your phone, you can blog from your mobile phone and you dont need a special phone for blogging. \n

    \n

    \nWhat is moblie bloging?\n

    \n

    \nMobile blogging is a method of publishing to a website or blog from a mobile phone or other handheld device. A mobile blogs help habitual bloggers to post write-ups directly from their phones even when on the move.\n

    \n

    \nWell i hope from the defination you understand what a mobile blog is and what we are trying to do here...\nwell as you might have guessed we are trying to create a free website or blog which you can update, design and post to directly from your mobile phone. \n

    \n

    \nRequirements:\n

    \n
      \n
    1. \nHTML\n
      2. \n
    2. \nCSS\n
      3. \n
    3. \nJAVASCRIPT (optional)\n
      4. \n
    4. \nGithub account\n
      5. \n
    5. \nSPCK Editor\n
      6. \n
    \n

    \nBefore you beging this series with me, it is required you just have a basic knowledge of Html, Css, and javascript is optional for now, well if you dont have a basic knowledge and you are just hearing about all this for the first time, dont worry this articles Getting Started With The Web , Structuring the web with HTML should basically get you started. \n

    \n

    \nOther requirements are the github account: Github is a subsidiary of Microsoft which provides hosting for software development and version control using Git.
    \nNow dont worry about the defination, you probably will never need it anyway. All you need is to Create an Account(which is totally free), head over to Github.com and create an account. \n

    \n

    \nThen Spck Editor, this is just a really cool code editor and js sandbox, this is the closest thing that is close to vscode on a mobile phone.
    \nHead over to play store search for \"Spck editor\" and install it. This editor is what we'll use to write to our blog...\n

    \n
    \n
    \n Note: It is required that you create a github account, and have downloaded and installed the app before you continue.
    \n Please don't use Opera Mini, use a modern browser like Chrome or Firefox\n
    \n
    \n

    \nGetting Started\n

    \n

    \nNow make sure you have created your Github account by signing up
    \nNow Click below link (Open in a different tab)
    \nJekyll now starter theme\n\n

    \n\n

    \n Now its time to Fork the starter theme
    \n click on the Forks icon \n

    \n \n

    \nThe page would reload and you would see a desktop view of the page, just look at the right side of the page at the header (top of the webpage) and click on fork\n

    \n\n

    \nAfter doing that the next page you are going to see would ask you to change your Forked theme name
    \nNow change the name of the website to: \"github-username.github.io\"\n

    \n \n \n

    \nNow its time to create a github token for the spck editor app you downloaded earlier...
    \nclick on the dropdown menu at the top of the page\n

    \n \n

    \n

      \n from the dropdown: \n
      \n
    1. Click on settings
      2. \n
    2. developer settings
      3. \n
    3. personal access tokens
      4. \n
    4. Generate New Token
      5. \n
    5. You may be asked for password, just enter your github password and continue
      6. \n
        \n
      1. Give it a note: Spck editor
        2. \n
      2. click on the repo box (select everything under it)
        3. \n
      3. Scroll select write:packages and admin:org
        4. \n
      4. Click \"Generate Token\"
        5. \n
      \n
    \n

    \n \n

    \nAfter you have generated your token ensure you copy it to your phone clipboard because you wont see again unless you re-generate it.\n

    \n \n

    \nIf you have followed this guide perfectly, you are just a few steps away from your newly phone managed blog or website.\n

    \n

    \nMoving on, Do you remember the \"Spck editor\" you downloaded earlier? Yep i guess you do
    \nNow open it up
    \nAnd you should see something that looks like this image below\n

    \n \n

    \nNext step is to look at the PROJECTS tab
    \nClick on the third icon (The fork icon)\n

    \n \n

    \nWhen you click on fork icon
    \nSelect credentials
    \nSet up your Credentials as follows:
    \nname: Github username
    \npassword/token: The token you Generated earlier (The one you copied)
    \nemail: for email (The one used in opening your github account)
    \nThen just Click on \"OK\"\n

    \n

    \nNow its time to clone your website to your mobile phone
    \nClick on the Fork icon again
    \nJust enter your Url like this

    \n\n

    \n url: https://github.com/github-username/github-username.github.io \n
    \njust change \"github-username\" to your own github username
    \nthen just Click on \"OK\"
    \nand wait for your website to clone (Speed depends on your internet connection, mine took a few seconds)\n

    \n \n

    \nYep, You guessed it, that's all. If you followed the steps correctly then i congratulate you(yeah you can feel proud). You have created a free website, and you can now manage, edit and design it on your mob ile phone. \n

    \n

    \nTo view your website
    \ngo to your browser
    \ntype in your website url
    \n\"github-username.github.io\"
    \nin my case \"sprucestatic.github.io\"\n

    \n \n

    \nHonestly you should be proud now. Welcome to the bloggers and website owners association of the world.
    \nNow you can go and tell your family members, friends, share it on facebook and twitter, about your new website... \n

    \n

    \nThough not really much now, Before the end of this series you will learn how to create and update a fully functional blog from your mobile phone...\n

    \n

    \n Next step is Customizing your new website, and introducing you to GIT on your mobile phone... Thanks for reading.\n

    \n
    \nNext part of this series\n
    \n

    \nCreate a blog on your mobile phone part 2\n

    \n","_templateContent":"

    \nWelcome to the series \"How to create a blog on your mobile phone with Jekyll on Github\"\n

    \n

    \nYep i said it... You can create a free blog from your mobile phone, so get ready to start your journey as a blogger... \n

    \n

    \na lot of people do ask:\n

      \n
    1. \nHow can i create a website with my phone?\n
      2. \n
    2. \nCan we blog from mobile?\n
      3. \n
    3. \nwhat is the best phone for blogging?\n
      4. \n
    \n

    \n

    \nYes, Yes and Yes you can create a website with your phone, you can blog from your mobile phone and you dont need a special phone for blogging. \n

    \n

    \nWhat is moblie bloging?\n

    \n

    \nMobile blogging is a method of publishing to a website or blog from a mobile phone or other handheld device. A mobile blogs help habitual bloggers to post write-ups directly from their phones even when on the move.\n

    \n

    \nWell i hope from the defination you understand what a mobile blog is and what we are trying to do here...\nwell as you might have guessed we are trying to create a free website or blog which you can update, design and post to directly from your mobile phone. \n

    \n

    \nRequirements:\n

    \n
      \n
    1. \nHTML\n
      2. \n
    2. \nCSS\n
      3. \n
    3. \nJAVASCRIPT (optional)\n
      4. \n
    4. \nGithub account\n
      5. \n
    5. \nSPCK Editor\n
      6. \n
    \n

    \nBefore you beging this series with me, it is required you just have a basic knowledge of Html, Css, and javascript is optional for now, well if you dont have a basic knowledge and you are just hearing about all this for the first time, dont worry this articles Getting Started With The Web , Structuring the web with HTML should basically get you started. \n

    \n

    \nOther requirements are the github account: Github is a subsidiary of Microsoft which provides hosting for software development and version control using Git.
    \nNow dont worry about the defination, you probably will never need it anyway. All you need is to Create an Account(which is totally free), head over to Github.com and create an account. \n

    \n

    \nThen Spck Editor, this is just a really cool code editor and js sandbox, this is the closest thing that is close to vscode on a mobile phone.
    \nHead over to play store search for \"Spck editor\" and install it. This editor is what we'll use to write to our blog...\n

    \n
    \n
    \n Note: It is required that you create a github account, and have downloaded and installed the app before you continue.
    \n Please don't use Opera Mini, use a modern browser like Chrome or Firefox\n
    \n
    \n

    \nGetting Started\n

    \n

    \nNow make sure you have created your Github account by signing up
    \nNow Click below link (Open in a different tab)
    \nJekyll now starter theme\n\n

    \n\n

    \n Now its time to Fork the starter theme
    \n click on the Forks icon \n

    \n \n

    \nThe page would reload and you would see a desktop view of the page, just look at the right side of the page at the header (top of the webpage) and click on fork\n

    \n\n

    \nAfter doing that the next page you are going to see would ask you to change your Forked theme name
    \nNow change the name of the website to: \"github-username.github.io\"\n

    \n \n \n

    \nNow its time to create a github token for the spck editor app you downloaded earlier...
    \nclick on the dropdown menu at the top of the page\n

    \n \n

    \n

      \n from the dropdown: \n
      \n
    1. Click on settings
      2. \n
    2. developer settings
      3. \n
    3. personal access tokens
      4. \n
    4. Generate New Token
      5. \n
    5. You may be asked for password, just enter your github password and continue
      6. \n
        \n
      1. Give it a note: Spck editor
        2. \n
      2. click on the repo box (select everything under it)
        3. \n
      3. Scroll select write:packages and admin:org
        4. \n
      4. Click \"Generate Token\"
        5. \n
      \n
    \n

    \n \n

    \nAfter you have generated your token ensure you copy it to your phone clipboard because you wont see again unless you re-generate it.\n

    \n \n

    \nIf you have followed this guide perfectly, you are just a few steps away from your newly phone managed blog or website.\n

    \n

    \nMoving on, Do you remember the \"Spck editor\" you downloaded earlier? Yep i guess you do
    \nNow open it up
    \nAnd you should see something that looks like this image below\n

    \n \n

    \nNext step is to look at the PROJECTS tab
    \nClick on the third icon (The fork icon)\n

    \n \n

    \nWhen you click on fork icon
    \nSelect credentials
    \nSet up your Credentials as follows:
    \nname: Github username
    \npassword/token: The token you Generated earlier (The one you copied)
    \nemail: for email (The one used in opening your github account)
    \nThen just Click on \"OK\"\n

    \n

    \nNow its time to clone your website to your mobile phone
    \nClick on the Fork icon again
    \nJust enter your Url like this

    \n\n

    \n url: https://github.com/github-username/github-username.github.io \n
    \njust change \"github-username\" to your own github username
    \nthen just Click on \"OK\"
    \nand wait for your website to clone (Speed depends on your internet connection, mine took a few seconds)\n

    \n \n

    \nYep, You guessed it, that's all. If you followed the steps correctly then i congratulate you(yeah you can feel proud). You have created a free website, and you can now manage, edit and design it on your mob ile phone. \n

    \n

    \nTo view your website
    \ngo to your browser
    \ntype in your website url
    \n\"github-username.github.io\"
    \nin my case \"sprucestatic.github.io\"\n

    \n \n

    \nHonestly you should be proud now. Welcome to the bloggers and website owners association of the world.
    \nNow you can go and tell your family members, friends, share it on facebook and twitter, about your new website... \n

    \n

    \nThough not really much now, Before the end of this series you will learn how to create and update a fully functional blog from your mobile phone...\n

    \n

    \n Next step is Customizing your new website, and introducing you to GIT on your mobile phone... Thanks for reading.\n

    \n
    \nNext part of this series\n
    \n

    \nCreate a blog on your mobile phone part 2\n

    \n"} Reading Time
  • norm

Spruce

December 20, 2020- Welcome to the series "How to create a blog on your mobile phone with Jekyll on Github" Yep i said it... You can create a free blog from your mobile phone, so get ready to...

DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F]","src_ZCc":"[ \\xA0\\u1680\\u2000-\\u200A\\u2028\\u2029\\u202F\\u205F\\u3000]|[!-#%-\\*,-\\/:;\\?@\\[-\\]_\\{\\}\\xA1\\xA7\\xAB\\xB6\\xB7\\xBB\\xBF\\u037E\\u0387\\u055A-\\u055F\\u0589\\u058A\\u05BE\\u05C0\\u05C3\\u05C6\\u05F3\\u05F4\\u0609\\u060A\\u060C\\u060D\\u061B\\u061E\\u061F\\u066A-\\u066D\\u06D4\\u0700-\\u070D\\u07F7-\\u07F9\\u0830-\\u083E\\u085E\\u0964\\u0965\\u0970\\u09FD\\u0A76\\u0AF0\\u0C84\\u0DF4\\u0E4F\\u0E5A\\u0E5B\\u0F04-\\u0F12\\u0F14\\u0F3A-\\u0F3D\\u0F85\\u0FD0-\\u0FD4\\u0FD9\\u0FDA\\u104A-\\u104F\\u10FB\\u1360-\\u1368\\u1400\\u166D\\u166E\\u169B\\u169C\\u16EB-\\u16ED\\u1735\\u1736\\u17D4-\\u17D6\\u17D8-\\u17DA\\u1800-\\u180A\\u1944\\u1945\\u1A1E\\u1A1F\\u1AA0-\\u1AA6\\u1AA8-\\u1AAD\\u1B5A-\\u1B60\\u1BFC-\\u1BFF\\u1C3B-\\u1C3F\\u1C7E\\u1C7F\\u1CC0-\\u1CC7\\u1CD3\\u2010-\\u2027\\u2030-\\u2043\\u2045-\\u2051\\u2053-\\u205E\\u207D\\u207E\\u208D\\u208E\\u2308-\\u230B\\u2329\\u232A\\u2768-\\u2775\\u27C5\\u27C6\\u27E6-\\u27EF\\u2983-\\u2998\\u29D8-\\u29DB\\u29FC\\u29FD\\u2CF9-\\u2CFC\\u2CFE\\u2CFF\\u2D70\\u2E00-\\u2E2E\\u2E30-\\u2E4E\\u3001-\\u3003\\u3008-\\u3011\\u3014-\\u301F\\u3030\\u303D\\u30A0\\u30FB\\uA4FE\\uA4FF\\uA60D-\\uA60F\\uA673\\uA67E\\uA6F2-\\uA6F7\\uA874-\\uA877\\uA8CE\\uA8CF\\uA8F8-\\uA8FA\\uA8FC\\uA92E\\uA92F\\uA95F\\uA9C1-\\uA9CD\\uA9DE\\uA9DF\\uAA5C-\\uAA5F\\uAADE\\uAADF\\uAAF0\\uAAF1\\uABEB\\uFD3E\\uFD3F\\uFE10-\\uFE19\\uFE30-\\uFE52\\uFE54-\\uFE61\\uFE63\\uFE68\\uFE6A\\uFE6B\\uFF01-\\uFF03\\uFF05-\\uFF0A\\uFF0C-\\uFF0F\\uFF1A\\uFF1B\\uFF1F\\uFF20\\uFF3B-\\uFF3D\\uFF3F\\uFF5B\\uFF5D\\uFF5F-\\uFF65]|\\uD800[\\uDD00-\\uDD02\\uDF9F\\uDFD0]|\\uD801\\uDD6F|\\uD802[\\uDC57\\uDD1F\\uDD3F\\uDE50-\\uDE58\\uDE7F\\uDEF0-\\uDEF6\\uDF39-\\uDF3F\\uDF99-\\uDF9C]|\\uD803[\\uDF55-\\uDF59]|\\uD804[\\uDC47-\\uDC4D\\uDCBB\\uDCBC\\uDCBE-\\uDCC1\\uDD40-\\uDD43\\uDD74\\uDD75\\uDDC5-\\uDDC8\\uDDCD\\uDDDB\\uDDDD-\\uDDDF\\uDE38-\\uDE3D\\uDEA9]|\\uD805[\\uDC4B-\\uDC4F\\uDC5B\\uDC5D\\uDCC6\\uDDC1-\\uDDD7\\uDE41-\\uDE43\\uDE60-\\uDE6C\\uDF3C-\\uDF3E]|\\uD806[\\uDC3B\\uDE3F-\\uDE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]){1,63})","src_domain":"(?:xn--[a-z0-9\\-]{1,59}|(?:(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ \\xA0\\u1680\\u2000-\\u200A\\u2028\\u2029\\u202F\\u205F\\u3000]|[!-#%-\\*,-\\/:;\\?@\\[-\\]_\\{\\}\\xA1\\xA7\\xAB\\xB6\\xB7\\xBB\\xBF\\u037E\\u0387\\u055A-\\u055F\\u0589\\u058A\\u05BE\\u05C0\\u05C3\\u05C6\\u05F3\\u05F4\\u0609\\u060A\\u060C\\u060D\\u061B\\u061E\\u061F\\u066A-\\u066D\\u06D4\\u0700-\\u070D\\u07F7-\\u07F9\\u0830-\\u083E\\u085E\\u0964\\u0965\\u0970\\u09FD\\u0A76\\u0AF0\\u0C84\\u0DF4\\u0E4F\\u0E5A\\u0E5B\\u0F04-\\u0F12\\u0F14\\u0F3A-\\u0F3D\\u0F85\\u0FD0-\\u0FD4\\u0FD9\\u0FDA\\u104A-\\u104F\\u10FB\\u1360-\\u1368\\u1400\\u166D\\u166E\\u169B\\u169C\\u16EB-\\u16ED\\u1735\\u1736\\u17D4-\\u17D6\\u17D8-\\u17DA\\u1800-\\u180A\\u1944\\u1945\\u1A1E\\u1A1F\\u1AA0-\\u1AA6\\u1AA8-\\u1AAD\\u1B5A-\\u1B60\\u1BFC-\\u1BFF\\u1C3B-\\u1C3F\\u1C7E\\u1C7F\\u1CC0-\\u1CC7\\u1CD3\\u2010-\\u2027\\u2030-\\u2043\\u2045-\\u2051\\u2053-\\u205E\\u207D\\u207E\\u208D\\u208E\\u2308-\\u230B\\u2329\\u232A\\u2768-\\u2775\\u27C5\\u27C6\\u27E6-\\u27EF\\u2983-\\u2998\\u29D8-\\u29DB\\u29FC\\u29FD\\u2CF9-\\u2CFC\\u2CFE\\u2CFF\\u2D70\\u2E00-\\u2E2E\\u2E30-\\u2E4E\\u3001-\\u3003\\u3008-\\u3011\\u3014-\\u301F\\u3030\\u303D\\u30A0\\u30FB\\uA4FE\\uA4FF\\uA60D-\\uA60F\\uA673\\uA67E\\uA6F2-\\uA6F7\\uA874-\\uA877\\uA8CE\\uA8CF\\uA8F8-\\uA8FA\\uA8FC\\uA92E\\uA92F\\uA95F\\uA9C1-\\uA9CD\\uA9DE\\uA9DF\\uAA5C-\\uAA5F\\uAADE\\uAADF\\uAAF0\\uAAF1\\uABEB\\uFD3E\\uFD3F\\uFE10-\\uFE19\\uFE30-\\uFE52\\uFE54-\\uFE61\\uFE63\\uFE68\\uFE6A\\uFE6B\\uFF01-\\uFF03\\uFF05-\\uFF0A\\uFF0C-\\uFF0F\\uFF1A\\uFF1B\\uFF1F\\uFF20\\uFF3B-\\uFF3D\\uFF3F\\uFF5B\\uFF5D\\uFF5F-\\uFF65]|\\uD800[\\uDD00-\\uDD02\\uDF9F\\uDFD0]|\\uD801\\uDD6F|\\uD802[\\uDC57\\uDD1F\\uDD3F\\uDE50-\\uDE58\\uDE7F\\uDEF0-\\uDEF6\\uDF39-\\uDF3F\\uDF99-\\uDF9C]|\\uD803[\\uDF55-\\uDF59]|\\uD804[\\uDC47-\\uDC4D\\uDCBB\\uDCBC\\uDCBE-\\uDCC1\\uDD40-\\uDD43\\uDD74\\uDD75\\uDDC5-\\uDDC8\\uDDCD\\uDDDB\\uDDDD-\\uDDDF\\uDE38-\\uDE3D\\uDEA9]|\\uD805[\\uDC4B-\\uDC4F\\uDC5B\\uDC5D\\uDCC6\\uDDC1-\\uDDD7\\uDE41-\\uDE43\\uDE60-\\uDE6C\\uDF3C-\\uDF3E]|\\uD806[\\uDC3B\\uDE3F-\\uDE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]))))\\.)*(?:xn--[a-z0-9\\-]{1,59}|(?:(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ \\xA0\\u1680\\u2000-\\u200A\\u2028\\u2029\\u202F\\u205F\\u3000]|[!-#%-\\*,-\\/:;\\?@\\[-\\]_\\{\\}\\xA1\\xA7\\xAB\\xB6\\xB7\\xBB\\xBF\\u037E\\u0387\\u055A-\\u055F\\u0589\\u058A\\u05BE\\u05C0\\u05C3\\u05C6\\u05F3\\u05F4\\u0609\\u060A\\u060C\\u060D\\u061B\\u061E\\u061F\\u066A-\\u066D\\u06D4\\u0700-\\u070D\\u07F7-\\u07F9\\u0830-\\u083E\\u085E\\u0964\\u0965\\u0970\\u09FD\\u0A76\\u0AF0\\u0C84\\u0DF4\\u0E4F\\u0E5A\\u0E5B\\u0F04-\\u0F12\\u0F14\\u0F3A-\\u0F3D\\u0F85\\u0FD0-\\u0FD4\\u0FD9\\u0FDA\\u104A-\\u104F\\u10FB\\u1360-\\u1368\\u1400\\u166D\\u166E\\u169B\\u169C\\u16EB-\\u16ED\\u1735\\u1736\\u17D4-\\u17D6\\u17D8-\\u17DA\\u1800-\\u180A\\u1944\\u1945\\u1A1E\\u1A1F\\u1AA0-\\u1AA6\\u1AA8-\\u1AAD\\u1B5A-\\u1B60\\u1BFC-\\u1BFF\\u1C3B-\\u1C3F\\u1C7E\\u1C7F\\u1CC0-\\u1CC7\\u1CD3\\u2010-\\u2027\\u2030-\\u2043\\u2045-\\u2051\\u2053-\\u205E\\u207D\\u207E\\u208D\\u208E\\u2308-\\u230B\\u2329\\u232A\\u2768-\\u2775\\u27C5\\u27C6\\u27E6-\\u27EF\\u2983-\\u2998\\u29D8-\\u29DB\\u29FC\\u29FD\\u2CF9-\\u2CFC\\u2CFE\\u2CFF\\u2D70\\u2E00-\\u2E2E\\u2E30-\\u2E4E\\u3001-\\u3003\\u3008-\\u3011\\u3014-\\u301F\\u3030\\u303D\\u30A0\\u30FB\\uA4FE\\uA4FF\\uA60D-\\uA60F\\uA673\\uA67E\\uA6F2-\\uA6F7\\uA874-\\uA877\\uA8CE\\uA8CF\\uA8F8-\\uA8FA\\uA8FC\\uA92E\\uA92F\\uA95F\\uA9C1-\\uA9CD\\uA9DE\\uA9DF\\uAA5C-\\uAA5F\\uAADE\\uAADF\\uAAF0\\uAAF1\\uABEB\\uFD3E\\uFD3F\\uFE10-\\uFE19\\uFE30-\\uFE52\\uFE54-\\uFE61\\uFE63\\uFE68\\uFE6A\\uFE6B\\uFF01-\\uFF03\\uFF05-\\uFF0A\\uFF0C-\\uFF0F\\uFF1A\\uFF1B\\uFF1F\\uFF20\\uFF3B-\\uFF3D\\uFF3F\\uFF5B\\uFF5D\\uFF5F-\\uFF65]|\\uD800[\\uDD00-\\uDD02\\uDF9F\\uDFD0]|\\uD801\\uDD6F|\\uD802[\\uDC57\\uDD1F\\uDD3F\\uDE50-\\uDE58\\uDE7F\\uDEF0-\\uDEF6\\uDF39-\\uDF3F\\uDF99-\\uDF9C]|\\uD803[\\uDF55-\\uDF59]|\\uD804[\\uDC47-\\uDC4D\\uDCBB\\uDCBC\\uDCBE-\\uDCC1\\uDD40-\\uDD43\\uDD74\\uDD75\\uDDC5-\\uDDC8\\uDDCD\\uDDDB\\uDDDD-\\uDDDF\\uDE38-\\uDE3D\\uDEA9]|\\uD805[\\uDC4B-\\uDC4F\\uDC5B\\uDC5D\\uDCC6\\uDDC1-\\uDDD7\\uDE41-\\uDE43\\uDE60-\\uDE6C\\uDF3C-\\uDF3E]|\\uD806[\\uDC3B\\uDE3F-\\uDE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])))))","tpl_host_fuzzy":"(?:(?:(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\\.){3}(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)|(?:(?:(?:(?:xn--[a-z0-9\\-]{1,59}|(?:(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F]))","tpl_host_fuzzy_strict":"(?:(?:(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\\.){3}(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)|(?:(?:(?:(?:xn--[a-z0-9\\-]{1,59}|(?:(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]))|(?:(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])(?!-|_|:\\d|\\.-|\\.(?!$|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])){0,61}(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F]))","tpl_host_port_fuzzy_strict":"(?:(?:(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\\.){3}(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)|(?:(?:(?:(?:xn--[a-z0-9\\-]{1,59}|(?:(?:(?![><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])(?!-|_|:\\d|\\.-|\\.(?!$|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F]|>|$))","tpl_email_fuzzy":"(^|[><｜]|\"|\\(|[ \\xA0\\u1680\\u2000-\\u200A\\u2028\\u2029\\u202F\\u205F\\u3000]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])([\\-;:&=\\+\\$,\\.a-zA-Z0-9_][\\-;:&=\\+\\$,\\\"\\.a-zA-Z0-9_]*@(?:(?:(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\\.){3}(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)|(?:(?:(?:(?:xn--[a-z0-9\\-]{1,59}|(?:(?:(?![><｜]|[ \\xA0\\u1680\\u2000-\\u200A\\u2028\\u2029\\u202F\\u205F\\u3000]|[!-#%-\\*,-\\/:;\\?@\\[-\\]_\\{\\}\\xA1\\xA7\\xAB\\xB6\\xB7\\xBB\\xBF\\u037E\\u0387\\u055A-\\u055F\\u0589\\u058A\\u05BE\\u05C0\\u05C3\\u05C6\\u05F3\\u05F4\\u0609\\u060A\\u060C\\u060D\\u061B\\u061E\\u061F\\u066A-\\u066D\\u06D4\\u0700-\\u070D\\u07F7-\\u07F9\\u0830-\\u083E\\u085E\\u0964\\u0965\\u0970\\u09FD\\u0A76\\u0AF0\\u0C84\\u0DF4\\u0E4F\\u0E5A\\u0E5B\\u0F04-\\u0F12\\u0F14\\u0F3A-\\u0F3D\\u0F85\\u0FD0-\\u0FD4\\u0FD9\\u0FDA\\u104A-\\u104F\\u10FB\\u1360-\\u1368\\u1400\\u166D\\u166E\\u169B\\u169C\\u16EB-\\u16ED\\u1735\\u1736\\u17D4-\\u17D6\\u17D8-\\u17DA\\u1800-\\u180A\\u1944\\u1945\\u1A1E\\u1A1F\\u1AA0-\\u1AA6\\u1AA8-\\u1AAD\\u1B5A-\\u1B60\\u1BFC-\\u1BFF\\u1C3B-\\u1C3F\\u1C7E\\u1C7F\\u1CC0-\\u1CC7\\u1CD3\\u2010-\\u2027\\u2030-\\u2043\\u2045-\\u2051\\u2053-\\u205E\\u207D\\u207E\\u208D\\u208E\\u2308-\\u230B\\u2329\\u232A\\u2768-\\u2775\\u27C5\\u27C6\\u27E6-\\u27EF\\u2983-\\u2998\\u29D8-\\u29DB\\u29FC\\u29FD\\u2CF9-\\u2CFC\\u2CFE\\u2CFF\\u2D70\\u2E00-\\u2E2E\\u2E30-\\u2E4E\\u3001-\\u3003\\u3008-\\u3011\\u3014-\\u301F\\u3030\\u303D\\u30A0\\u30FB\\uA4FE\\uA4FF\\uA60D-\\uA60F\\uA673\\uA67E\\uA6F2-\\uA6F7\\uA874-\\uA877\\uA8CE\\uA8CF\\uA8F8-\\uA8FA\\uA8FC\\uA92E\\uA92F\\uA95F\\uA9C1-\\uA9CD\\uA9DE\\uA9DF\\uAA5C-\\uAA5F\\uAADE\\uAADF\\uAAF0\\uAAF1\\uABEB\\uFD3E\\uFD3F\\uFE10-\\uFE19\\uFE30-\\uFE52\\uFE54-\\uFE61\\uFE63\\uFE68\\uFE6A\\uFE6B\\uFF01-\\uFF03\\uFF05-\\uFF0A\\uFF0C-\\uFF0F\\uFF1A\\uFF1B\\uFF1F\\uFF20\\uFF3B-\\uFF3D\\uFF3F\\uFF5B\\uFF5D\\uFF5F-\\uFF65]|\\uD800[\\uDD00-\\uDD02\\uDF9F\\uDFD0]|\\uD801\\uDD6F|\\uD802[\\uDC57\\uDD1F\\uDD3F\\uDE50-\\uDE58\\uDE7F\\uDEF0-\\uDEF6\\uDF39-\\uDF3F\\uDF99-\\uDF9C]|\\uD803[\\uDF55-\\uDF59]|\\uD804[\\uDC47-\\uDC4D\\uDCBB\\uDCBC\\uDCBE-\\uDCC1\\uDD40-\\uDD43\\uDD74\\uDD75\\uDDC5-\\uDDC8\\uDDCD\\uDDDB\\uDDDD-\\uDDDF\\uDE38-\\uDE3D\\uDEA9]|\\uD805[\\uDC4B-\\uDC4F\\uDC5B\\uDC5D\\uDCC6\\uDDC1-\\uDDD7\\uDE41-\\uDE43\\uDE60-\\uDE6C\\uDF3C-\\uDF3E]|\\uD806[\\uDC3B\\uDE3F-\\u \\xA0\\u1680\\u2000-\\u200A\\u2028\\u2029\\u202F\\u205F\\u3000]|[!-#%-\\*,-\\/:;\\?@\\[-\\]_\\{\\}\\xA1\\xA7\\xAB\\xB6\\xB7\\xBB\\xBF\\u037E\\u0387\\u055A-\\u055F\\u0589\\u058A\\u05BE\\u05C0\\u05C3\\u05C6\\u05F3\\u05F4\\u0609\\u060A\\u060C\\u060D\\u061B\\u061E\\u061F\\u066A-\\u066D\\u06D4\\u0700-\\u070D\\u07F7-\\u07F9\\u0830-\\u083E\\u085E\\u0964\\u0965\\u0970\\u09FD\\u0A76\\u0AF0\\u0C84\\u0DF4\\u0E4F\\u0E5A\\u0E5B\\u0F04-\\u0F12\\u0F14\\u0F3A-\\u0F3D\\u0F85\\u0FD0-\\u0FD4\\u0FD9\\u0FDA\\u104A-\\u104F\\u10FB\\u1360-\\u1368\\u1400\\u166D\\u166E\\u169B\\u169C\\u16EB-\\u16ED\\u1735\\u1736\\u17D4-\\u17D6\\u17D8-\\u17DA\\u1800-\\u180A\\u1944\\u1945\\u1A1E\\u1A1F\\u1AA0-\\u1AA6\\u1AA8-\\u1AAD\\u1B5A-\\u1B60\\u1BFC-\\u1BFF\\u1C3B-\\u1C3F\\u1C7E\\u1C7F\\u1CC0-\\u1CC7\\u1CD3\\u2010-\\u2027\\u2030-\\u2043\\u2045-\\u2051\\u2053-\\u205E\\u207D\\u207E\\u208D\\u208E\\u2308-\\u230B\\u2329\\u232A\\u2768-\\u2775\\u27C5\\u27C6\\u27E6-\\u27EF\\u2983-\\u2998\\u29D8-\\u29DB\\u29FC\\u29FD\\u2CF9-\\u2CFC\\u2CFE\\u2CFF\\u2D70\\u2E00-\\u2E2E\\u2E30-\\u2E4E\\u3001-\\u3003\\u3008-\\u3011\\u3014-\\u301F\\u3030\\u303D\\u30A0\\u30FB\\uA4FE\\uA4FF\\uA60D-\\uA60F\\uA673\\uA67E\\uA6F2-\\uA6F7\\uA874-\\uA877\\uA8CE\\uA8CF\\uA8F8-\\uA8FA\\uA8FC\\uA92E\\uA92F\\uA95F\\uA9C1-\\uA9CD\\uA9DE\\uA9DF\\uAA5C-\\uAA5F\\uAADE\\uAADF\\uAAF0\\uAAF1\\uABEB\\uFD3E\\uFD3F\\uFE10-\\uFE19\\uFE30-\\uFE52\\uFE54-\\uFE61\\uFE63\\uFE68\\uFE6A\\uFE6B\\uFF01-\\uFF03\\uFF05-\\uFF0A\\uFF0C-\\uFF0F\\uFF1A\\uFF1B\\uFF1F\\uFF20\\uFF3B-\\uFF3D\\uFF3F\\uFF5B\\uFF5D\\uFF5F-\\uFF65]|\\uD800[\\uDD00-\\uDD02\\uDF9F\\uDFD0]|\\uD801\\uDD6F|\\uD802[\\uDC57\\uDD1F\\uDD3F\\uDE50-\\uDE58\\uDE7F\\uDEF0-\\uDEF6\\uDF39-\\uDF3F\\uDF99-\\uDF9C]|\\uD803[\\uDF55-\\uDF59]|\\uD804[\\uDC47-\\uDC4D\\uDCBB\\uDCBC\\uDCBE-\\uDCC1\\uDD40-\\uDD43\\uDD74\\uDD75\\uDDC5-\\uDDC8\\uDDCD\\uDDDB\\uDDDD-\\uDDDF\\uDE38-\\uDE3D\\uDEA9]|\\uD805[\\uDC4B-\\uDC4F\\uDC5B\\uDC5D\\uDCC6\\uDDC1-\\uDDD7\\uDE41-\\uDE43\\uDE60-\\uDE6C\\uDF3C-\\uDF3E]|\\uD806[\\uDC3B\\uDE3F-\\uDE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])[\\0-\\uD7FF\\uE000-\\uFFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF][\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]|[\\uD800-\\uDBFF](?![\\uDC00-\\uDFFF])|(?:[^\\uD800-\\uDBFF]|^)[\\uDC00-\\uDFFF]))))\\.)+(?:%TLDS%)))(?=$|[><｜]|[ DE46\\uDE9A-\\uDE9C\\uDE9E-\\uDEA2]|\\uD807[\\uDC41-\\uDC45\\uDC70\\uDC71\\uDEF7\\uDEF8]|\\uD809[\\uDC70-\\uDC74]|\\uD81A[\\uDE6E\\uDE6F\\uDEF5\\uDF37-\\uDF3B\\uDF44]|\\uD81B[\\uDE97-\\uDE9A]|\\uD82F\\uDC9F|\\uD836[\\uDE87-\\uDE8B]|\\uD83A[\\uDD5E\\uDD5F]|[\\0-\\x1F\\x7F-\\x9F])(?!-|_|:\\d|\\.-|\\.(?!$|[ \\xA0\\u1680\\u2000-\\u200A\\u2028\\u2029\\u202F\\u205F\\u3000]|[!-#%-\\*,-\\/:;\\?@\\[-\\]_\\{\\}\\xA1\\xA7\\xAB\\xB6\\xB7\\xBB\\xBF\\u037E\\u0387\\u055A-\\u055F\\u0589\\u058A\\u05BE\\u05C0\\u05C3\\u05C6\\u05F3\\u05F4\\u0609\\u060A\\u060C\\u060D\\u061B\\u061E\\u061F\\u066A-\\u066D\\u06D4\\u0700-\\u070D\\u07F7-\\u07F9\\u0830-\\u083E\\u085E\\u0964\\u0965\\u0970\\u09FD\\u0A76\\u0AF0\\u0C84\\u0DF4\\u0E4F\\u0E5A\\u0E5B\\u0F04-\\u0F12\\u0F14\\u0F3A-\\u0F3D\\u0F85\\u0FD0-\\u0FD4\\u0FD9\\u0FDA\\u104A-\\u104F\\u10FB\\u1360-\\u1368\\u1400\\u166D\\u166E\\u169B\\u169C\\u16EB-\\u16ED\\u1735\\u1736\\u17D4-\\u17D6\\u17D8-\\u17DA\\u1800-\\u180A\\u1944\\u1945\\u1A1E\\u1A1F\\u1AA0-\\u1AA6\\u1AA8-\\u1AAD\\u1B5A-\\u1B60\\u1BFC-\\u1BFF\\u1C3B-\\u1C3F\\u1C7E\\u1C7F\\u1CC0-\\u1CC7\\u1CD3\\u2010-\\u2027\\u2030-\\u2043\\u2045-\\u2051\\u2053-\\u205E\\u207D\\u207E\\u208D\\u208E\\u2308-\\u230B\\u2329\\u232A\\u2768-\\u2775\\u27C5\\u27C6\\u27E6-\\u27EF\\u2983-\\u2998\\u29D8-\\u29DB\\u29FC\\u29FD\\u2CF9-\\u2CFC\\u2CFE\\u2CFF\\u2D70\\u2E00-\\u2E2E\\u2E30-\\u2E4E\\u3001-\\u3003\\u3008-\\u3011\\u3014-\\u301F\\u3030\\u303D\\u30A0\\u30FB\\uA4FE\\uA4FF\\uA60D-\\uA60F\\uA673\\uA67E\\uA6F2-\\uA6F7\\uA874-\\uA877\\uA8CE\\uA8CF\\uA8F8-\\uA8FA\\uA8FC\\uA92E\\uA92F\\uA95F\\uA9C1-\\uA9CD\\uA9DE\\uA9DF\\uAA5C-\\uAA5F\\uAADE\\uAADF\\uAAF0\\uAAF1\\uABEB\\uFD3E\\uFD3F\\uFE10-\\uFE19\\uFE30-\\uFE52\\uFE54-\\uFE61\\uFE63\\uFE68\\uFE6A\\uFE6B\\uFF01-\\uFF03\\uFF05-\\uFF0A\\uFF0C-\\uFF0F\\uFF1A\\uFF1B\\uFF1F\\uFF20\\uFF3B-\\uFF3D\\uFF3F\\uFF5B\\uFF5D\\uFF5F-\\uFF65]|\\uD800[\\uDD00-\\uDD02\\uDF9F\\uDFD0]|\\uD801\\uDD6F|\\uD802[\\uDC57\\uDD1F\\uDD3F\\uDE50-\\uDE58\\uDE7F\\uDEF0-\\uDEF6\\uDF39-\\uDF3F\\uDF99-\\uDF9C]|\\uD803[\\uDF55-\\uDF59]|\\uD804[\\uDC47-\\uDC4D\\uDCBB\\uDCBC\\uDCBE-\\uDCC1\\uDD40-\\uDD43\\uDD74\\uDD75\\uDDC5-\\uDDC8\\uDDCD\\uDDDB\\uDDDD-\\uDDDF\\uDE38-\\uDE3D\\uDEA9]|\\uD805[\\uDC4B-\\uDC4F\\uDC5B\\uDC5D\\uDCC6\\uDDC1-\\uDDD7\\uDE41-\\uDE43\\uDE60-\\uDE6C\\uDF3C-\\uDF3E]|\\uD806[\\uDC3B\\uDE3F-\\u     \r\nHey there welcome to my personal blog where i write about my learning process as a supposed web designer.\r\n

    \r\n \r\n

    \r\nThis site (My personal blog) Which was lunched on the 18th of November is my own personal online journal where i blog about everything web design.\r\n

    \r\n

    \r\n This site is built with Jekyll and hosted on Github. And as u might have guessed this site was built and designed be Me (Spruce) \r\n

    \r\n

    What i blog about

    \r\n

    \r\nEhn things i blog about are just a view minimal things:\r\n

    \r\n\r\n
      \r\n
    1. \r\nHTML\r\n
      2. \r\n
    2. \r\nCSS\r\n
      3. \r\n
    3. \r\nJAVASCRIPT\r\n
      4. \r\n
    4. \r\nJEKYLL\r\n
      5. \r\n
    5. \r\nand some DESIGN TIPS\r\n
      6. \r\n
    \r\n

    Once again welcome aboard...

    \r\n\r\n

    \r\n\r\n{%- include footer.html -%}\r\n{% include theme.html
